topic: Genie AI's new feature Document compare

documents.product_roadmap:
Product Roadmap Summary
Feature Name: Document Compare
 Problem: Reviewing contract versions is tedious and error-prone.
 Solution: Genie Document Compare instantly highlights differences between two legal documents, letting users focus on what matters.
 Audience: Founders, execs, and small business operators (non-lawyers).
 Benefits:
Save hours per review
Spot hidden risks fast
Share clean, unified redlines
Build trust with counterparties
 Launch CTA: â€œTry Document Compare free on Genie today â†’ app.genieai.coâ€
documents.engineering_ticket:
Feature: Document Compare
 Author: Dan
 Version: 0.9 (beta)
Overview
Native diff engine built into Genieâ€™s real-time editor. Designed to:
Compare two Genie docs (same schema) OR a Genie doc vs external file.
Produce two outputs:
Side-by-side diff â€“ shows insertions/deletions line-by-line.
Unified diff view â€“ single merged doc with redlines.
Implementation
Uses operational transform (OT) layer diffing.
Handles moved-paragraph detection (with fallback).
Outputs deterministic hashes for auditability (Diff ID).
AI integration (optional): summarise key changes, flag risky clauses, suggest rewrite.
Known Issues
PDF extraction unreliable â†’ fallback to â€œcontent onlyâ€ comparison.
Parallel edits cause false conflicts (to be improved with per-block locks).
Performance degrades slightly >100 pages; mitigated with virtualised rendering.
Dependencies
genie-engine (internal module)
pdf-parser
openai-client (for explain-the-diff)

Nitish (CTO): Itâ€™s all built into our editor, not a third-party plugin. You can compare any two Genie docs, or even upload a DOCX to compare with one in the system.
Will: So this is a native Genie feature, not some external viewer?
Nitish: Exactly. Full diff engine. We show both side-by-side and merged diff view. The merged diff is exportable - great for sharing with investors or counterparties.
Ed (Sales): Thatâ€™s gold. Weâ€™ve had so many enterprise leads asking for â€œredline exports.â€

Nitish: Yep. But avoid making it sound like a legal opinion generator - weâ€™re not summarising contracts yet, thatâ€™s another feature.
Sophie: We actually are planning to add an â€œAI explain the diffâ€ sidebar later though.
Will: Should we mention that in the blog?

[crosstalk about lunch catering and a Slack bug - irrelevant]
Will: Sorry, ignore that part - we donâ€™t need to mention the Mixpanel tracking schema in the marketing piece.
Sophie: Wait, the metric weâ€™re tracking post-launch is % of Pro Plan companies doing 2+ compares per week, right?
Nitish: Correct.
